section_4_readiness_confidence.observations:
Highlights: Ivves has done a great job building a relationship with the customer and staying on top of day-to-day on-site operations. She understand the account/customer's processes and expectations. She communicates well with frontline staff. She is not shy of working across multiple shifts and has gone above and beyond with overseeing events and special projects.

Areas of opportunity: Ivves communication needs major improvement. She does not communicate effectively and/or on-time, does not acknowledge all emails and requests across all departments: Ops, HR, Upper Management, Recruiting. Ivves has not attended frontline interviews scheduled with candidates and/or communicated regarding timing/scheduling. Ivves has not been involved with 4Insite during her 1st month, other than performing 3 internal audits. She missed two safety reports regarding frontline staff that results in the Account Manager reporting to EHS. She is very hands-on with the staff and the account, leaving her no time to focus on 4Insite, administrative tasks, and timely communication.

Please know that the MIT has completed and passed the program and is currently working out of the site LOCK20LITTL, which I am the manager of. I was the mentor during the program and Katie did well through the program. Now that it is over, I do believe there is more to desired. I am not seeing this person take any real ownership of any part of the operations of the site. Yes, she will do whatever is asked of her although any time cleaning is involved, the attitude and demeanor of this individual changes and not for the good.

Of course, as a Manager, you do not want to be cleaning, but the needs of the business far outweigh (or should) the wants of the manager. It does not seem like Katie can either hold up for the entire day or chooses not to as I am unaware of a full week passing by in which she has put in a full weeks worth of time (40hrs).

I would really like to see Kathryn, while at my site and waiting to be placed in a permanent role, gravitate toward a specific thing and take it over. Fully dive in to this specific thing and tear it down to rebuild it bigger, badder and better. The site cannot afford her compensation and has, in place, a good management team that works well together and understands the client, the SBM employees, and the daily ins and outs associated with the job.

The more time that passes by without her placement and being the one responsible and held accountable, I believe has a negative impact on her abilities to be a Manager of a site her own. She is NOT utilizing the things that she learned in the program. UKG/UTA, IN Suite, and does not have the engagement with the other branches of the business like procurement, HR, Payroll, CC. These are skills or tools that are polished by using them. When you are not, they become dull.

Lloyd has shown willingness to adapt to changes and schedules. He is consistently asking questions of proper department leads and expectations. Lloyd was also very engaged in the introduction call. Lloyd has also already begun taking on his own shift including managing the employees, speaking with the customer, and completing daily 4insite tasks.
Lloyd did miss one of the mandatory 6 meetings for the MIT program. However, Lloyd did immediately reach out to Renee West and explained the situation. Lloyd will now be on the January meeting.
Agrein just started the MIT program yesterday. She has not been introduced to audits. Being new to janitorial she does seem a little overwhelmed with the site size and number of employees.
mentee forgot about our one on one Team's meeting to follow up on progress. Has lots of questions where it appears she's trying to get me to give her the answer

Evan is exceeding expectations across the board. His journalism and editorial background translates into exceptional communication skills and meticulous attention to detail. He demonstrates outstanding adaptability and initiative, consistently volunteering for challenging assignments.

This week, Evan independently led a client walkthrough, proactively identified three process improvement opportunities, and mentored newer team members on quality control procedures. His perfect scores in soft skills reflect his natural leadership presence and collaborative spirit.

Key Strengths:
• Exceptional problem-solving under pressure
• Strong operational knowledge and safety awareness
• Natural communicator who builds rapport quickly
• Takes initiative without prompting
• Adapts seamlessly to changing priorities

Development Opportunities:
• Continue building experience with budget management
• Expand knowledge of advanced scheduling systems

Overall Assessment: Evan is already taking on independent responsibilities with confidence and shows readiness for accelerated progression into site management. His consistent high performance, combined with his enthusiasm for learning, makes him an ideal candidate for priority placement opportunities. I have full confidence in his ability to succeed in an Assistant Operations Manager role or higher. Highly recommend for immediate consideration.
One of the best hires I have ever done

Overall, Jesus is doing a great job. There are a couple of areas for improvement regarding leadership presence and communicating confidently. I know he is new to his role, but we need someone with a "Voice" that commands respect and demonstrates confidence in their ability to lead a team. Jesus is very hesitant/reluctant when making a decision, even when he knows it's the correct decision. Little by little, I will work with him to ensure he receives the support he needs and feels empowered to lead effectively.
Jesus is quickly adapting to and learning SBM Operations. He is doing a great job and has already started building positive relationships with clients and his team.

Jesus is doing a phenomenal job leading his team and driving results. His confidence when speaking to his team or the customer can sometimes come across as shy or intimidated, even when he has the correct answers or the right game plan. He needs to be more confident in his communication and delivery.

Shaq has taken the program by storm and worked to stay on track if not ahead. When Shaq is given tasks, he takes ownership and responsibility over the success or failures of the outlined tasks. Shaq is extremely coachable and maintains a thirst for knowledge daily. He works and strives to improve and build within the team. I am proud to be a part of and watch Shaq's journey as he will continue to grow and progress with SBM.
Great engagement and willing to learn! He is ambitious and very professional to all! Fully encaged with all site activities.
Created fliers to help attract people to apply for open custodian positions.
Kathy was willing to travel to support our AR sort in chicago as well as adapting well to changing requests due to Amazon peak season
Stephany has a high sense of urgency and so far is a great team player.

Stephany has demonstrated strong leadership and great customer service skills. She is always taking notes and questions on every item, retaining the information and uses on daily basis. She is learning safety items and the importance on the company and keep learning the importance of 4insite
Traci is very good on the computer and really picked up 4insite
Traci is continuing to excel when learning new tasks and her understanding of 4insite.
Traci continues to show improvement each day
He has been willing to support night shift operations, cleanroom shifts, special projects on the weekend and has not shied away from putting in the necessary hours to be successful
Has been doing great at being hands on and being involved

The mentee can navigate 4insite confidently and complete audits: Mentee has mastered the basic functions to-date. However a full understanding of all of 4insites tools takes time. 1 internal quality audit completed to date.

The mentee had a set back due to a sudden illness and death in thier family. This put us a few days behind on our interally developed schedule for site level goals. However, the mentee has shown willingness to learn, retain knowledge and support various shifts and sites durring thier time otherwise.
Orlando has been working ahead of schedule and is willing to take on anything that's been thrown at him. He has also been able to develop relationships with employees and our client on site.

Orlando has been very hands-on since day one. He is ready and eager to take on more than what is given daily, and for what SBM has to offer in knowledge and management perspectives. I think he will do great!
Orlando has been working ahead of schedule and is willing to take on anything that has been thrown at him. He has also been able to develop relationships with employees and our client on site.

Juan shows a strong sense of urgency and works independently with little direction. His current opportunity is to better understand how things operate at SBM and apply his knowledge in a way that fits this environment. The team seems to be adjusting to him well. There is still room for improvement with audits, especially in fully understanding their purpose for growth and quality. He should focus on understanding the "why" behind certain requests before making suggestions.

Juan shows a strong sense of urgency and works independently with little direction. His current opportunity is to better understand how things operate at SBM and apply his knowledge in a way that fits this environment. The team seems to be adjusting to him well. There is still room for improvement with audits, especially in fully understanding their purpose for growth and quality. He should focus on understanding the "why" behind certain requests before making suggestions.
This is a week 1 review- the data shared above is based on a one-week evaluation
Eddie has been very attentive to details and absorbing information as well as already working with the crew to understand their tasks
Eddie is doing great we tossed him a scheduling curve ball this week to assist with a site that is in need. Eddie stepped up to the task!
Humberto has become more comfortable with daily tasks and audits. He is also continuing to understand scope of work better and being able to apply it.
Humberto has become more comfortable with daily tasks and audits. He is also continuing to understand scope of work better and being able to apply it.
Humberto has taken more initiative in learning routes, people, and processes.
